Nightshift sniffs the air, sensing a suspicious property to what could be b=
ehind the door.  He was not about to make any foolish moves but, he wanted =
to hear what was happening on the other side.   

" Okay, catch twenty one.=
  In order ta find out what's go'n down we gotta be right up ta that door w=
ithout gett'n spotted.  But if we do that, we risk tripp'n off a security a=
larm.  Batscout, see if ya spot any gaps around the door.  You got a better=
 chance at it than I do."

Don't be envious of what you don't have, be grat=
eful for things you already posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and =
friends.

On Nov 17, 2011, at 6:26 AM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@gmail.=
com> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Nightshift takes his time going into the tun=
nel as he scans the way
> > constantly for signs of unwanted company.
> >
>=
 > " Can never be too careful. Especially in these kinda situations. Now ta=

> > find out if I was right about someone hack'n the systems."
> >
> > He =
continues but at a cautious pace, keeping close to the cover of darkness
> =
> as he can.
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> Keeping to the shadows is easy. Once the door =
is closed there was
> absolutely no light and the only sounds were from BAT=
SCOUT where he
> hovered in the air, his wings flapping somewhere in the da=
rkness and
> the sound of NIGHTSHIFT's own movement as he padded along.
> 
=
> There was the soft sounds coming from the movement lake above them.
> The=
 walls and ceiling seemed stout enough, but it was a reminder of
> the hund=
reds of tons of water that was held suspended above their
> heads as they m=
oved. The air itself was cold, ice collecting in the
> corners, but not eno=
ugh to be a true hazard as long as one was
> cautious.
> 
> Soon enough the=
y arrived at the other side of the tunnel as they came
> to the other door,=
 the one that would allow them to enter CRYONOSIS
> itself. Light blazed fo=
r a moment as BATSCOUT shined a light on the
> door. It seemed to be a dupl=
icate of the original door that was on the
> other side of the tunnel.
> 
>=
 It was closed.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> - Preston
>

<html><head></head><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Nightshift sniffs the air=
, sensing a suspicious property to what could be behind the door.  He =
was not about to make any foolish moves but, he wanted to hear what was hap=
pening on the other side.   </div><div><br></div><div>" Okay, cat=
ch twenty one.  In order ta find out what's go'n down we gotta be righ=
t up ta that door without gett'n spotted.  But if we do that, we risk =
tripp'n off a security alarm.  Batscout, see if ya spot any gaps aroun=
d the door.  You got a better chance at it than I do."</div><div><br>D=
on't be envious of what you don't have, be grateful for things you already =
posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends.</div><div><br>=

      <p>>=
 <OLD><br>
><br>
> Nightshift takes his time going into the tun=
nel as he scans the way<br>
> constantly for signs of unwanted company.<=
br>
><br>
> " Can never be too careful.  Especially in these kinda si=
tuations.  Now ta<br>
> find out if I was right about someone hack'n the=
 systems."<br>
><br>
> He continues but at a cautious pace, keeping c=
lose to the cover of darkness<br>
> as he can.<br>
<br>
<NEW><br>
=
<br>
Keeping to the shadows is easy. Once the door is closed there was<br>
=
absolutely no light and the only sounds were from BATSCOUT where he<br>
hov=
ered in the air, his wings flapping somewhere in the darkness and<br>
the s=
ound of NIGHTSHIFT's own movement as he padded along.<br>
<br>
There was th=
e soft sounds coming from the movement lake above them.<br>
The walls and c=
eiling seemed stout enough, but it was a reminder of<br>
the hundreds of to=
ns of water that was held suspended above their<br>
heads as they moved. Th=
e air itself was cold, ice collecting in the<br>
corners, but not enough to=
 be a true hazard as long as one was<br>
cautious.<br>
<br>
Soon enough the=
y arrived at the other side of the tunnel as they came<br>
to the other doo=
r, the one that would allow them to enter CRYONOSIS<br>
itself. Light blaze=
d for a moment as BATSCOUT shined a light on the<br>
door. It seemed to be =
a duplicate of the original door that was on the<br>
other side of the tunn=
el.<br>
<br>
It was closed.<br>
